definition: straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera

sentences.english: Some words do a miss house not say too to keep white.
sentences.chinese: 有些話做牛觀花家的不好說的太過直白了。

sentences.english: On hearing that, her face went white to the lips.
sentences.chinese: 一聽那話她臉色登時變得蒼白，直白到嘴脣了。

sentences.english: The flat refusal made Dursley's chins quiver, but after a moment he persisted.
sentences.chinese: 直白的拒絕讓德思禮的下巴抽動起來。

sentences.english: To put it more plainly, is the text dictation, typing in the computer.
sentences.chinese: 說得更直白一些，就是聽寫，把文字敲進電腦裏。

sentences.english: In plain English: the system's processors can not be over-subscribed by the total of the entitlements.
sentences.chinese: 直白地說，標稱值的總和不能超過系統的處理器數量。

sentences.english: The cards from schoolchildren are sweet and plain-spoken.
sentences.chinese: 這些卡片都是學校學生寫的，甘美並且直白。

sentences.english: You talk to your boss so bluntly, aren't you afraid that he will give you a hard time?
sentences.chinese: 你和領導說話這麼直白，不怕他給你穿小鞋嗎？

sentences.english: A report released last Friday by JPMorgan Chase was even blunter.
sentences.chinese: 上週五由摩根大通銀行發佈的報告講得更是直白。

sentences.english: They understand that it’s no longer “cool” to explicitly seek wealth.
sentences.chinese: 他們知道過於直白地追財逐利不再是那麼“酷”了。

sentences.english: Straightly speaking, that will only work here if the curve goes counterclockwise.
sentences.chinese: 直白的說，只有逆時針的曲線是成立的。

sentences.english: Another prominent Taoist martial artist Shi Fei is less diplomatic.
sentences.chinese: 另一位著名道教武術大師史飛則更爲直白。

sentences.english: I merely try to present the facts in a clear and straightforward manner.
sentences.chinese: 我只想用一種清晰而直白的方式擺出事實。

definition: see 直截了當|直截了当[zhi2 jie2 liao3 dang4]
to contain/to hold/(of a person or style etc) reserved/restrained/(of words, writings) full of hidden meaning/implicit/veiled (criticism)
to hold back from saying precisely what is on one's mind
lit. going round the curves and skirting the corners (idiom)/fig. to speak in a roundabout way/to equivocate/to beat about the bush
